revised_title: A Detailed Account of the Effects of a Thunderstorm and Lightning on Pembroke College, Oxford
tldr: A letter from Mr. Griffith describes the damage caused by a lightning strike at Pembroke College, Oxford, on June 3, 1765. The lightning entered the college through four different points, causing significant damage to rooms, windows, and personal belongings. The author provides a detailed account of the effects in each room and discusses the possible causes and consequences of the lightning strike.
